reviews.review_msg: You might feel a bit intimidated when you first meet him but you will quickly see he's got a great big heart. One of my favourite professors at SFU and if I could take another class with him I definitely would

You can tell that he's very passionate about archaeology, but unfortunately his lectures are so mind-numbingly boring that it's impossible to focus. It makes it very hard to understand and keep up with the content. Avoid this class; it's not entertaining, easy, or at all worth the effort.

Horrible professor, had very dry lectures, and had horrible communication skills. Very confusing, he stares into your soul, and you never know what he is thinking. He also has a bias and hates people who are not good at archaeology.

Trainwreck of a professor! Not very good at lecturing and horrible communication skills! You don't know what to expect from him and he makes you feel bad about not being good at Archaeology. I hate Archaeology now because of his inability to teach and communicate. Very hard to understand and very scary. Avoid this prof at all costs!

Horrible professor! Please do not take this class with him. Incredibly boring 3-hour lecture. The material is interesting, but avoid this class because this professor does not help. I feel like I wasted my time taking this class. He's not clear what he expects from you; he is very simple-minded. Very confusing grading criteria! Worst Professor ever

Engaging in lectures and incorporates many personal stories about his time in the field. He gave me a much longer extension than other professors were willing to give when I injured my arm. I took Arch 101 with him and he offered a tour of the Archaeology department at the end of the class. Looks a bit like Nick Offerman. Amazing moustache.

She completely rips off the whole course from David Maxwell.. She is not even doing her job, she doesn't have lectures, she doesn't mark, TAs take forever to mark a multiple choice “quiz” on Canvas? I would recommend taking this course with just David Maxwell, since all of these recorded lectures of from him anyways. Overrated.

Eccentric is a fitting word. I took a distance ed course with him. I did well on the assignments, paper, and final exam. Yet, for some reason, I got only a B. This summer, he was supposed to offer another distance ed course. However, for some reason, he decided to offered it as a lecture course instead this semester, throwing off my program...

Professor Muir was very kind and easy to reach out to. He responds to emails quickly and gives helpful feedback, if you ask for it. Read the rubric carefully for each assignment, pay attention to his slides/videos (majority of exam material is from there, not the textbook). It's definitely a GPA booster class, I enjoyed it and recommend it!

TA's mark the assignments very harshly. They will deduct significant marks if you have improper referencing. This prof on the other hand, his always grumpy for some reason and deliberately wants to catch his students cheating. He would generate AI made papers for himself and would then cross check your assignment to see if they match.

took arch101 intersession & found it pretty easy, asynch w weekly discussions worth 35% & 3 fairly short assignments worth a total of 65%. bob is easy to reach out to, replies to emails quickly, & provides good feedback. weekly films were assigned which I enjoyed bc they were really interesting! def recommend this class for b-soc, good gpa booster

Professor was kind but teaching style, not great. Lectures were 3h long without variety in learning - basically her reading off her 90+ slides powerpoints the entire time. Whole course was graded based on three online exams (thank goodness they were open book) because the exam was a whole lot of random facts that would be impossible to memorize.

DO NOT TAKE! Lectures are 3 hours long, the prof just reads the 60+ powerpoint slides with 100 words on each. Your grade relays upon 3 “quizzes”, each quiz asks questions about random facts or information in any of those powerpoint slides, or videos she shows in class (she only shows 2 minutes of the video and makes you watch later). Prof is nice.

The course is very lecture heavy about 3 hours per week, and most of the stuff on the quiz was difficult to find on the lecture slides, despite the slides being so detailed. Quizzes were very short too, 1 minute per question. I can't even speak of her teaching ability since she took all the content from another professor.

Taking this course was a mistake as Laurie does not prepare her students for the quizzes or assignments. She expects her students to understand everything about arch just by reading off the slides. Avoid this class.
